diseases.title: Disease Information
diseases.subtitle: Learn about common seasonal diseases and their symptoms

flu.name: Influenza (Flu)
flu.description: A contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses.
flu.symptoms: Fever, cough, sore throat, body aches, fatigue
flu.prevention: Annual flu vaccine, hand washing, avoiding close contact with sick people
flu.causes: Influenza A, B, and C viruses transmitted through respiratory droplets
flu.treatments: Antiviral medications like oseltamivir (Tamiflu), rest, fluids, pain relievers, annual vaccination

cold.name: Common Cold
cold.description: A viral infection of the upper respiratory tract.
cold.symptoms: Runny nose, sore throat, cough, congestion, sneezing
cold.prevention: Hand washing, avoiding touching face, staying away from sick people
cold.causes: Over 200 different viruses, most commonly rhinoviruses
cold.treatments: Rest, fluids, over-the-counter medications for symptoms, usually resolves in 7-10 days

malaria.name: Malaria
malaria.symptoms: Fever, chills, headache, nausea, muscle pain
malaria.prevention: Mosquito nets, insect repellents, antimalarial medication
malaria.causes: Plasmodium parasites transmitted by Anopheles mosquitoes
malaria.treatments: Antimalarial drugs like chloroquine, artemisinin-based therapies, preventive medications for travelers

dengue.name: Dengue Fever
dengue.symptoms: High fever, severe headache, pain behind eyes, joint and muscle pain
dengue.prevention: Mosquito control, wearing long sleeves, using repellents
dengue.causes: Dengue virus transmitted by Aedes mosquitoes
dengue.treatments: Supportive care, fluids, pain relievers, rest, severe cases require hospitalization

diarrhea.name: Seasonal Diarrhea
diarrhea.description: Often caused by contaminated food or water during monsoon.
diarrhea.symptoms: Frequent loose stools, abdominal pain, dehydration
diarrhea.prevention: Safe drinking water, proper food hygiene, hand washing
diarrhea.causes: Contaminated food or water, bacterial infections like cholera or salmonella, viral infections, parasitic infections
diarrhea.treatments: Oral rehydration solutions, antibiotics if bacterial, rest, proper nutrition, avoid antidiarrheal medications without medical advice
